attributes.action: Cater for women's needs at work
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Women can suffer very badly when menstruating. If they have to have a day off work then it either makes their sick record look bad, or they have to use up their holiday entitlement.

Why is there no "official" option for women to have a day, or half a day off work when suffering form a particularly painful period? In some women it can cause sickness / the runs. 

In many workplaces it isn't taken seriously because the industry is male dominated. Being male isn't an excuse for ignorance; there is scientific proof of the illness or pain that some women experience.

Some workplaces have adopted "duvet days" which can be used for this purpose. But it's not a legal obligation so many women still suffer.

I strongly believe that women should be given a minimum of 6 days per year, separate from holiday entitlement, for this purpose.
